It seems tobe generally agreed, however, that the Dutch are in amuch better position to resist than they were last autumn, and that, provided they put up a decent res is t-ance, we ought to be able to come to their help.This was a very rambling discussion - what thediplomats call a tour d' horizon, covering the iron oretraffic, the position in the Balkans, the Royal marine operation, the likelihood of an early Meeting of theSupreme War Council, and. one or two other matters in passing. It seemed to be generally agreed that we arepassing through one of our periodical bad patches, fromthe point of view of prestige abroad. The French, inparticular, are jumpy and anxious to do something, andare liable to try and push us into something ratherfoolish.Minute 5.The naval situation.The First Lord gave more details of the Luleaproject.
